evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: All analyses described in this plan will be performed using SAS v9.4 or higher unless specified otherwise.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP does not specify software in Section 4.1 (it is blank), but Generated SAP specifies SAS v9.4. This adds detail without contradiction.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Continuous data will be summarized using descriptive statistics: the number of observations (n), mean, standard deviation, minimum, median and maximum unless otherwise indicated.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The term “descriptive statistics” refers to the number of patients (n), mean, median, standard deviation (SD), minimum, and maximum for continuous variables
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Continuous variables will be summarized by reporting the number of observations (n), mean, standard deviation, median, minimum, and maximum.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Categorical data will be summarized using numbers and percentages of patients.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: refers to the number and/or percentage of patients (or events) for categorical variables.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Categorical variables will be summarized using frequency tables showing the number and percentage of patients within a particular category.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The baseline value for all analyses will be the last non-missing value prior to the first infusion unless otherwise specified.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Baseline Value: Defined as the last non-missing observation (including central laboratory results, vital signs, and tumor assessments) recorded prior to the First Dose Date.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Post-baseline visits will be considered to be all visits after the first infusion.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Change from Baseline Value: Calculated as (Post-Baseline Value – Baseline Value).
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP implies post-baseline logic in its change from baseline definition.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: EOT and unscheduled visit will not be summarized in visit-based tables, unless otherwise indicated.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Unscheduled laboratory assessments... will be excluded from by-visit summary tables unless they fall within a visit window and are the closest assessment to the target day
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP explicitly excludes unscheduled visits from visit-based tables (implying a nominal visit analysis strategy). Generated SAP explicitly includes them if they map to a visit window (implying a windowing analysis strategy). This is a methodological contradiction.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Missing values in ORR will be considered as ‘Non-responder’ to analyze primary efficacy endpoint.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Missing Data: Patients with no post-baseline tumor assessment or whose response cannot be evaluated (NE) will be treated as non-responders for the primary analysis.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: In order to evaluate the impact of missing data on the primary efficacy endpoint results, additional analyses with tipping point analyses will be conducted
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Local review result will be used as supportive data (sensitivity analysis).
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP requires Tipping Point Analysis. Generated SAP omits it. Protocol is silent on Tipping Point Analysis (only mentions Local Review as sensitivity). Therefore, Generated SAP is compliant with Protocol, even though it differs from Original SAP.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: (Detailed rules for Medication, AE, and Death imputation in Section 14.4)
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP omits the detailed date imputation rules found in the Original SAP. This is a loss of detail but not a direct contradiction.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Minimum and maximum will be presented to the same number of decimal places as the raw data, mean and median will be presented to one more decimal place...
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP omits formatting rules. Acceptable difference.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Minimum and maximum will be presented to the same number of decimal places as the raw data
mean and median will be presented to one more decimal place than the raw data
standard deviation will be presented to two more decimal places than the raw data.
If the geometric mean is to be presented, it will be set to the same precision as the mean.
Percent coefficient of variation (CV) will be presented to two more decimal places than the raw data.
Percentages will be presented to one decimal place and will be suppressed when the count is zero.
A row denoted “Not Done” will be included in count tabulations where necessary to account for cases of no assessment or missing values.
The denominator for all percentages will be the number of patients within the treatment group for the population of interest, unless otherwise indicated.
But, all data will be displayed in listings.
Listings will be sorted by the treatment group and then patient number, which is the unique subject identifier and visit, if applicable.
In cases where more additional sorting is required, other variables will be included in sorting as applicable.

For the purpose of summarization, any numeric values recorded below the lower limit or above the upper limit of quantification will be set to the respective limit for all related summaries unless otherwise indicated.
In listings, original results containing inequality sign will be displayed, unless otherwise specified.
Recorded as collected sample in eCRF but no corresponding results from analytical facility – listing will display only sample collection visit/date/time from eCRF.
No corresponding records in eCRF for results from analytical facility – listing will display only specimen collection visit/date and results from analytical facility.

Discrepancy in sample collection date from eCRF and analytical facility – listing will display results from analytical facility and visit/date/time from eCRF if not missing; if sample collection date/time is missing in eCRF then use specimen collection visit/date from analytical facility.
Any outliers that are detected during the review of the data will be investigated and discussed during the DRM.
In general, outliers will not be excluded unless they are considered to be erroneous values.
Sensitivity analyses and exploratory analyses may be conducted using imputation or excluding outliers to ensure robustness of study conclusions.
Tipping point analyses will be conducted under Missing Not at Random (MNAR) scenarios.
Imputation will be done by gradually shifting the number of responders by treatment group to make MNAR scenarios.
95% CI of the difference between two proportions (CT-P16 and EU-Approved Avastin group) will be estimated by exact binomial approach
scenarios will be displayed by shift table.
No response evaluation result or inevaluable (NE) result evaluated in best overall response (BOR) will be considered as missing case.
All the scenarios will be also provided using 2-dimensional plot.
If ‘Yes’ is recorded for ‘If stop date is unknown, was this drug stopped before the first administration of study drug?’... Assume the first administration date – 1.
If ‘No’... Missing day: Assume the last day of the month.
Missing day and month: Assume December 31st.
Missing day, month and year: Leave it as Missing.
In the case of the death of a patient and the imputed end date is after the date of death, the end date will be imputed as the date of death.
If the stop date is incomplete, imputed end date will be used instead of reported end date
Missing day... month and year... equal... start date will be imputed as the earlier date of: (i) the date of the first infusion, or (ii) the recorded/imputed stop date of the medication.

missing_from_generated_sap.component: Medication Start Date Imputation (Day - Equal - Missing Stop)
missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If the recorded/imputed stop date is missing, the start date will be imputed as the first infusion.

missing_from_generated_sap.component: Medication Start Date Imputation (Day - Not Equal)
missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If the month or the year are not equal... start date will be imputed as the first day of the month
Missing day and month... year... equal... start date will be imputed as the earlier date of: (i) the date of the first infusion, or (ii) the recorded/imputed stop date...

missing_from_generated_sap.component: Medication Start Date Imputation (Month - Equal - Missing Stop)
missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If... missing, the start date will be imputed as the first infusion.

missing_from_generated_sap.component: Medication Start Date Imputation (Month - Not Equal)
missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If the year are not equal... start date will be imputed as the first day of January of the year
Missing day: Assume the last day of the month.
Missing day and month: Assume December 31st.
Missing day, month and year: Leave it as Missing.
In the case of the death of a patient and the imputed stop date is after the date of death, the stop date will be imputed as the date of death.
Missing day... month and year... equal... start date will be imputed as the earlier date of: (i) the date of the first infusion, or (ii) the recorded/imputed stop date of the AE.

missing_from_generated_sap.component: AE Start Date Imputation (Day - Equal - Missing Stop)
missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If the recorded/imputed stop date of the AE is missing, the start date will be imputed as the first infusion.

missing_from_generated_sap.component: AE Start Date Imputation (Day - Not Equal)
missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If the month or the year are not equal... start date will be imputed as the first day of the month
Missing day and month... year... equal... start date will be imputed as the earlier date of: (i) the date of the first infusion, or (ii) the recorded/imputed stop date of the AE.

missing_from_generated_sap.component: AE Start Date Imputation (Month - Equal - Missing Stop)
missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If the recorded/imputed stop date is missing, the start date will be imputed as the first infusion.

missing_from_generated_sap.component: AE Start Date Imputation (Month - Not Equal)
missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If the year are not equal... start date will be imputed as the first day of January of the year
Missing day, month and year... start date will be imputed as the earlier date of: (i) the date of first infusion, or (ii) the recorded/imputed stop date of the AE.

missing_from_generated_sap.component: AE Start Date Imputation (Year - Missing Stop)
missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If the recorded/imputed stop date is missing, the start date will be imputed as the date of first infusion.
If the reason for end of study participation... is ‘Death’ and the death date is incomplete, then death date will be imputed as the date of end of study participation
If the day of death is missing... month and year... equal... death date will be imputed as the last known alive date + 1.

If the month and year are not equal, the death date will be imputed as the first day of the month... provided partial death date > last known alive date. Otherwise, death date will be imputed as the last known alive date + 1.
If the day and month of death date is missing... year... equal... death date will be imputed as the last known alive date + 1.
If partial year > year of the last known alive date, then death date will be imputed as 1st January of that year... Otherwise, death date will be imputed as the last known alive date + 1.

The randomization will be balanced by using permuted blocks and will be stratified by country, sex (female vs. male), disease status (recurrence vs. metastatic), Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status (0 vs. 1).
missing_from_generated_sap.protocol_text: The randomization will be balanced by using permuted blocks and will be stratified by country, sex (female vs. male), disease status (recurrence vs. metastatic), and ECOG performance score (0 vs. 1).
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Randomization details missing from General Methodology section (though covariates are mentioned in efficacy section).

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: This study will be double-blinded during both the Induction Study Period and the Maintenance Study Period.
missing_from_generated_sap.protocol_text: This study will be double-blind... during the Whole Study Period.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Blinding details missing from General Methodology section.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: The database will be unblinded for the 1st CSR for a reporting purpose. However, the study will remain blinded to the investigators and patients until study termination.
missing_from_generated_sap.protocol_text: The study will be unblinded to the pre-defined unblinded personnel... after the completion of Cycle 6... for the reporting purposes.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Unblinding details missing from General Methodology section.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Major protocol deviations will be identified during the DRM. Patients with major protocol deviation could be excluded from PP population
missing_from_generated_sap.protocol_text: A major protocol deviation is one that may affect the interpretation of primary endpoint and it will be defined in the SAP.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Protocol deviation handling missing from General Methodology section.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Additionally, if any case of major protocol deviation related to COVID-19 is identified during the DRM, primary analysis will be performed excluding patients with major protocol deviation related to COVID-19 in ITT population as supportive analysis
Data collected on the ‘General Comments’ eCRF page will be presented in a listing for the ITT population.
The total number of patients who were screened will be displayed. The number of screening failures and the primary reason for screening failure will also be summarized.

The number of patients who have been randomized and the number and percentage of patients who have initiated the study period, have completed the Induction study period, and have discontinued the study period will also be displayed
Time on the study drug prior to discontinuation in each study period will be calculated as (Last dose date – First dose date + 1) and will also be summarized with descriptive statistics.
Reason for ending participation in the study will be summarized by reasons on the ‘End of Study Participation’ eCRF page.
Deaths will be summarized by reasons using the data reported on ‘Study Treatment Termination’ or ‘Survival Status’ eCRF page.
Patient disposition data will be listed for the ITT population. A listing of patients reported as screening failure will also be provided with reasons for screening failure.

issues.original_sap_text: EOT and unscheduled visit will not be summarized in visit-based tables, unless otherwise indicated.
issues.generated_sap_text: Unscheduled laboratory assessments... will be excluded from by-visit summary tables unless they fall within a visit window and are the closest assessment to the target day
issues.why_they_conflict: Original SAP excludes unscheduled visits from visit-based tables (implying nominal visits). Generated SAP includes them if they map to a visit window. This is a methodological difference.
issues.description: Generated SAP uses a windowing approach for unscheduled visits, while Original SAP uses a nominal visit approach (excluding unscheduled visits from visit tables).
issues.reasoning: Original SAP Section 4 explicitly states unscheduled visits will not be summarized in visit-based tables. Generated SAP Section 4.5.4 explicitly states they will be included if they fall within a window. This changes the data included in by-visit summaries.

issues.original_sap_text: In order to evaluate the impact of missing data on the primary efficacy endpoint results, additional analyses with tipping point analyses will be conducted
issues.why_they_conflict: Original SAP requires Tipping Point Analysis. Generated SAP omits it. Protocol is silent on Tipping Point Analysis (only mentions Local Review as sensitivity). Therefore, Generated SAP is compliant with Protocol, even though it differs from Original SAP.
issues.description: Detected conflict between Original and Generated SAP

reasoning: The Generated SAP captures the high-level definitions (Baseline, Descriptive Statistics) correctly but omits a significant amount of detailed general methodology found in the Original SAP, specifically regarding formatting (decimal places), data handling (outliers, discrepancies), and imputation rules (dates). It also introduces a 'Visit Windowing' strategy for unscheduled visits which contradicts the 'Nominal Visit' strategy implied in the Original SAP (where unscheduled visits are excluded from visit tables). However, the Protocol is silent on these specific methodological choices, so the Generated SAP is not non-compliant with the Protocol, just less detailed and methodologically different from the Original SAP in one aspect. The omission of Tipping Point Analysis is notable as it was a specific robustness check in the Original SAP, but since the Protocol does not require it, it is classified as an acceptable difference.
summary: The Generated SAP is less detailed than the Original SAP, omitting specific formatting, data handling, and imputation rules. It introduces a visit windowing methodology that differs from the Original SAP's nominal visit approach for unscheduled visits. However, it remains compliant with the Protocol's high-level requirements.
